message.content:
cs.CR, cs.NI, cs.SE, cs.DC, cs.CY 

This paper investigates the security of electronic communication protocols, specifically email and chat, and their use of TLS encryption and authentication mechanisms. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). The paper also involves network infrastructure and monitoring, which suggests cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) as a possible sub-category. The study also addresses client-to-server and server-to-server interactions, which could fall under cs.SE (Software Engineering) or cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing). Finally, the paper discusses the insecure nature of electronic communication, which could be relevant to cs.CY (Computers and Society).
